result.execSummary:
The defendant John Carl Wigley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 9-17-15 or, if not paid, civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Carl Wigley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John Carl Wigley in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  John Michael Stoiber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 5 days  in the House of Correction,  with credit for 5 days time served.

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 9-17-15  or, if not paid, civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant John Carl Wigley in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses Justice Point report.  No action taken.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant John Carl Wigley in court with  Student Intern Michelle Cahoon under the supervision attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant John Carl Wigley in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Due to lower pending cases, Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
